input: But he told us that he could not drum up much interest in or money for such a purpose from Washington, partly, he thought, because these countries had dictatorial governments. [SEP] How often did he try to drum up interest? [SEP] twice per minute
The two suicide operatives chosen were Hassan al Khamri and Ibrahim al Thawar, also known as Nibras. [SEP] How long did it take to chose the operatives? [SEP] 6 centuries
A plant uses a lot of energy to produce nectar. [SEP] What happens after the nectar is produced? [SEP] it carrying a lot of debt
The two suicide operatives chosen were Hassan al Khamri and Ibrahim al Thawar, also known as Nibras. [SEP] At what time did the suicide operatives act? [SEP] 9:00 AM

In one of the paintings, a character has been cut out and is instead sitting on the painting's frame, perhaps taking a break from posing? [SEP] What did the artist do when he finished the painting? [SEP] the artist threw the painting into the trash after he finished it
Another unit was added on to the communal dwelling each time a marriage created a new family. [SEP] How often are units added? [SEP] one century

Mama kept her mink jacket, a family hand-me-down, safe from time in a stopbox, and lent the capturador to my uncle for his stamp collection. [SEP] How often does Mama put the jacket in the stopbox? [SEP] every three centuries
There are many haras (breeding stables) in the neighbourhood, and the big Norman posters are much in demand. [SEP] For how long are the haras rented? [SEP] 87 years
